title: Cumbria coal mine: What is the controversy about?
description: Cumbrian councillors are reviewing their support for a controversial coal mine near Whitehaven.

title: Weather: 'Fantastic' ice formations line Welsh roadsides
description: They are thought to be formed by cars driving though puddles and spraying trees in icy conditions.

title: Rare Nasa photos reveal Amazon 'gold rivers'
description: The satellite images reveal miles of unregistered gold mining in Peru's Amazon rainforest, Nasa says.

title: Libby Squire: Pawel Relowicz guilty of student's murder
description: Pawel Relowicz had denied preying upon "vulnerable" University of Hull student Libby Squire.

title: Ford returns for England as Lawrence dropped
description: George Ford, Courtney Lawes, Kyle Sinckler and Mako Vunipola all return to England's starting XV for Saturday's Six Nations match against Italy.

title: Covid-19: 'Too early' to decide on summer holidays, says Hancock
description: The health secretary's comments prompted criticism from Labour who said people wanted clarity.

title: Covid hotel quarantine booking site taken down
description: The new booking portal website was removed temporarily for maintenance over a technical error.

title: Stella Creasy threatens legal action over paid maternity leave for ministers
description: Giving ministers - and not all MPs - time off for a baby is unfair, says Labour's Stella Creasy.

title: Arthritis drug tocilizumab cuts deaths from Covid
description: Giving it along with a steroid drug can help the sickest patients with Covid-19, research reveals.

title: Brexit: London loses out as Europe's top share trading hub
description: Amsterdam ousts London in the wake of Brexit changes, as the Bank of England warns over EU financial rules.

title: England in India 2021: Liam Livingstone in Twenty20 squad
description: Lancashire batsman Liam Livingstone is included in England's Twenty20 squad for next month's tour of India.

title: Australian Open: Rafael Nadal sets up Cameron Norrie meeting in Melbourne
description: Rafael Nadal will meet Britain's Cameron Norrie in the Australian Open third round after both win their matches on Thursday.

title: Dylan Freeman: Mother who suffocated son with sponge detained
description: Three psychiatric reports found Olga Freeman was suffering from a severe depressive illness.

title: HS2: Next phase of controversial rail network gets green light
description: Legislation needed to clear the next stage of the controversial project has passed through Parliament.

title: Mum and daughter on studying nursing at same university
description: Tracy and her daughter Sarah are both studying the courses at Liverpool John Moores University.

title: NHS reform: 'No better time than now' for changes, says Matt Hancock
description: The aim is for health and social care to join up more, but Labour questions the timing of the move.

title: Ex-health secretary Jeremy Hunt breaks arm in fall while out running
description: Former health secretary is back at work - from home - hours after being treated at his local hospital.

title: Covid in Scotland: Vaccination programme 'may need to slow down'
description: The country has received lower Pfizer vaccine stocks than expected due to a reduction in manufacturing capacity.

title: Warrington & Whyte feature in five-fight BBC Radio 5 Live commentary deal
description: Britain's Josh Warrington and Dillian Whyte will feature on five fight nights to be broadcast by BBC Radio 5 Live.

title: Six Nations: Scotland make three changes for Wales at Murrayfield
description: Blade Thomson, James Lang and Darcy Graham come into the Scotland XV for Saturday's Six Nations meeting with Wales at Murrayfield.

title: Year-long routine surgery waits 'worst since 2008' in England
description: In January, hospitals in England treated nearly a third of all Covid patients since the pandemic began.

title: Missed stamp duty holiday deadline 'would cost us £12,000'
description: A rush to complete sales before tax breaks end on 31 March is causing delays and calls for government help.

title: 'Go further than you have promised,' football authorities tell Twitter and Facebook
description: Football governing bodies unite to ask Twitter and Facebook to "accept responsibility for preventing abuse".

title: Pigs can play video games with their snouts, scientists find
description: Despite poor vision and a severe lack of thumbs, Hamlet and other pigs could learn to be gamers.

title: Fundraising friends raise thousands for hospital
description: Hughie is finding out how the hospital he and his friend raised thousands of pounds for will be spending the money.

title: Gina Carano dropped from Mandalorian after 'abhorrent' posts
description: Lucasfilm says the actor's comments are 'abhorrent' and has no plans to work with her again.

title: Tom Brady throws trophy across water as Tampa Bay Buccaneers celebrate Super Bowl success
description: Tom Brady throws the Vince Lombardi Trophy from one boat to another during the Tampa Bay Buccaneers' Super Bowl victory parade

title: The powers being used to disrupt a terror group
description: Evidence seen by BBC News reveals how terror prevention measures are used to tackle radicalisers.

title: Tomas Soucek: West Ham midfielder's rise from rejection to Premier League star
description: Unwanted by second-tier clubs back home and considered clumsy, Tomas Soucek has emerged as one of this season's standout players.

title: GameStop investors on a wild ride: 'It was a rollercoaster of emotion'
description: Now that the dust has settled, who are the winners and losers in the GameStop saga?

title: How has coronavirus affected mental health?
description: Coronavirus has had a big impact on our mental health, but have services been able to keep up?

title: The Great Indian Kitchen: Serving an unsavoury tale of sexism in home
description: The drama that unfolds in a grimy kitchen raises unsettling questions about insidious sexism within homes.

title: The cinemas now hiring out their screens to gamers
description: With cinemas badly hit by Covid-19 restrictions they are looking for new revenue streams.

title: Elisa Lam: What really happened in the Cecil Hotel
description: The 21-year-old went missing in 2013, and internet folklore has haunted her memory ever since.

title: Pablo Escobar: Why scientists want to kill Colombia's hippos
description: Illegally brought to Colombia by drug baron Pablo Escobar, the animals have become a major headache.

title: 'What is happening to my spine?'
description: Liberty, from Leicester, discovered she could bend her body in half while watching a Rihanna video.

title: Egypt's revolution: 'The roar of the crowd shook my feet'
description: Photographer Laura El-Tantawy looks back at her work documenting the 2011 revolution in Egypt.

title: Central African Republic: A country under siege
description: The BBC's Africa correspondent Catherine Byaruhanga explains what’s going on in Central African Republic, where rebels have surrounded the capital Bangui.

title: Numbats: Saving a marsupial 'unique even to Australia'
description: The numbat is one of the world’s most endangered animals, with about 1,000 left in the wild.
